text: one question I get a lot is how often
you should be washing your face and what
do people really do wrong when they're
washing their faces a lot of people
think that if they wash their skin less
you're actually going to stop stripping
the skin it's going to be more
moisturized that's kind of true but in
my opinion what you see with that is you
wind up having more buildup of oils on
your skin and that actually can cause
more breakouts and acne so for the
average person I would say that washing
your face every day is important and
sometimes twice a day
one thing people don't know is that you
actually have to change what you're
cleansing your face with with the
seasons so in the summer for example you
should be using a cleanser that's a
little bit more astringent and what that
means is using something that might have
a little more of a sudsing capacity or
maybe even have salicylic acid in it if
your acne prone and then in the winter
time you want to be using one that's
much more gentle one that's less soap
based and that's because it doesn't
strip your skin of oils and then the
other thing is if you're using these
products too frequently or with a harsh
cleansing method like a washcloth for
example or if you're using a clear sonic
I love Claire sonics but if you use them
too harshly on your skin press too hard
you actually could irritate your skin
more so those are those are some tips
that I like to tell my patients
